publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-450 Mr Brian Monteith: Committee of Inquiry into Sex Education—That the Parliament supports the establishment of an official committee of enquiry to consider the provision of sex education in Scottish schools, with a remit to ensure that relationships form the context for discussion and teaching of this subject, and to establish clear guidelines, enforceable by law, of what topics and materials are appropriate for pupils of varying age, experience and maturity; and that repeal of section 2A of the Local Government Act 1986 be postponed until the Parliament is able to consider a report of such an enquiry. Supported by: Phil Gallie*, Ben Wallace*, Mary Scanlon*, Mr Jamie McGrigor*, Alex Johnstone*, Bill Aitken*, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*, David Mundell*, Nick Johnston*, John Young*, Mr Murray Tosh*, Mr David Davidson*, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh*
